thread.title: Arsene Wenger sits in stands with Chelsea fans… while suspended midfielder Granit Xhaka is in Arsenal away end
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger sits in stands with Chelsea fans… while suspended midfielder Granit Xhaka is in Arsenal away end

author: fnathan
title: Arsene Wenger sits in stands with Chelsea fans… while suspended midfielder Granit Xhaka is in Arsenal away end
text:
ARSENE WENGER is sitting in the stands at Stamford Bridge with Chelsea fans – but keeps having his view blocked by a cheering fan. 
The Arsenal boss, serving a four game ban for pushing a linesman, has made sure he is near the dugouts to communicate with his technical area – and looked glum as the Blues took the lead. 6 Arsene Wenger looks glum in the stands at Stamford Bridge 
He was not the only Gunners employee sitting in the stands, as suspended midfielder Granit Xhaka took his place in the Arsenal away end, smiling with fans. 6 The Frenchman was left annoyed when a cheering fan blocked his view 
This is the third match Wenger is watching away from the dugout but this time he is sat with Blues supporters rather than the directors’ box, which is on the other side of the stadium. related articles No risk taken Hector Bellerin subbed off after taking elbow to the face in first Prem game at Stamford Bridge since Ryan Mason fractured skull HIGH NOON Chelsea 1 Arsenal 0: Marcos Alonso scores early goal for the Blues as Arsene Wenger faces D-Day from the stands 'More of the same' Graeme Souness has ripped into the Arsenal squad criticising their mental strength and soft underbelly FOXES AND MOLES Is there a mole in the Leicester side secretly working to undermine struggling Claudio Ranieri? 'So David Brent' John Terry's Virtual Reality Football Academy branded 'most self-centred thing since Donald Trump on the Apprentice' Around the world Chelsea's N'Golo Kante gives a brilliant reply to THAT joke - and it's almost as impressive as his performances griez lightening The United effect, Paul Pogba and three more reasons why Antoine Griezmann WILL join Manchester United D-DAY FOR WENGER Wenger will divide Arsenal fans more than ever if Chelsea beat Gunners and tighten grip on title race beijing derby Chelsea vs Arsenal in Beijing - Premier League duo to face each other in Bird's Nest Stadium this summer Rash choice Harry Kane fears for Marcus Rashford's future at Manchester United with Zlatan Ibrahimovic around MIND MADE UP Real Madrid ace Alvaro Morata tells friends he is moving to Chelsea this summer, not Arsenal TEAM NEWS What is the injury news for Tottenham vs Middlesbrough, when is the game being played and what TV channel is it on? Rex Features And security guards had to intervene when Chelsea scored the first goal as fans celebrated towards Wenger Getty Images 6 Arsene Wenger allegedly called referee Jon Moss a “cheat” during Arsenal’s 2-1 win over Burnley 
Wenger is surrounded with security in the middle of the East Stand because it the same side as the tunnel – meaning he has easy access to the dressing room. 
The 67-year-old is allowed to give his side team talks before kick off and at half time as well as having to fulfil his media duties. Twitter 6 Suspended midfielder Granit Xhaka was with fans in the Arsenal away end 
Arsenal and Chelsea came to an agreement for him to sit on the terraces and arranged for stewards to escort him to his seat. 
But he looked annoyed a happy fan in front of him jumped to his feet to celebrate Marco Alonso’s opening goal in the lunch time kick-off today. Reuters 6 He has to sit with Chelsea fans in order to be near the dugout and the dressing rooms 
And security guards had to step in when the opener was scored, with Blues fans celebrating towards the Frenchman.
